instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A how to turn on without power button
threads.message:
I wonder how to turn on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board without button? What should I look for on a schematic or a board view? How are those pads called?
Thx

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A how to turn on without power button
threads.message: I have green light and fan turns on as soon as I connect power supply, in 20 seconds fan starts spinning at top speed.  I wish I could turn it on and see if there is any video at all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A how to turn on without power button
threads.message:
iFixit has info how to jumpstart MBP 2011 [url]https://www.ifixit.com/Answers/View/115622/Jumpstart+MacBook+Pro+2011[/url]

When pads are shorted - fan turns off and otherwise it goes at maximum speed. No video comes out of DP port

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A how to turn on without power button
threads.message: This motherboard turn on by itself after you connect charger, no need to short pads......  Fan speeds at max. because there is no trackpad attached or you have a sensor failure..... Does this board chime?? any blink on frontal white led??  display assemblly is connected??? any history about this board?? water damage, dropped, anything??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A how to turn on without power button
threads.message: Thanks! It doesn't chime, got that board from eBay without any history for the sake of practicing, connected just fan and RAM. It doesn't look damaged or worked on. Where do I begin to make it chime?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A how to turn on without power button
threads.message: Measure <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> and if it is not present look long and hard at <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>.
